name: places/ChIJswHut5lZwokRT5xI9BGe98w
formattedAddress: 500 E 14th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 500 E 14th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
Never reviewed places but I feel the need to do so now.

I only came to see the neurologist because I can get in sooner. People waiting in the hall in a straight line waiting for the doctor is a bad look. Unnecessary tests are done, staff walking in the room and now I THE PATIENT have to accommodate to my doctor's schedule after I book in advance as if I don't have to work. You call me the night before my appointment to reschedule as if I didn't make room for this appointment to basically tell me to call out again. If this was a patient doing this the clinic would be hounding them for a fee. Unprofessional and unorganized.

Just save yourself a headache and stay away from here and the clinic close by.

originalText.text:
On the evening of October 7th, 2024 @ 5:45pm I walk into the Radiology clinic for a CT scan at 500 East 14th Street. When I walk in, I said hello and I was greeted with “check in over there” not a hello how are you today? Just waived over to a machine. Next, a young man calls me up and hands me paperwork to fill out. As I’m filling out the paperwork, he says from across the room Melody you have an outstanding balance. He Violated the Hippa privacy law that I am entitled to, I said "when I am done will talk about it". I finished and walked up to the desk; the young man proceeds to tell me about an outstanding balance. I ask "when is this balance from as this is the first time, I visit this practice and I just saw the Doctor, who referred me for the first time 2wks prior. He says, “that’s when it’s from”. How is this outstanding? He says we won’t be able to see you unless it’s paid. I asked to speak to a manager as I was not aware of it, no one informed me. He then called someone on the phone who stands on "we will not be able to see you unless the balance is paid".   The balance is a whopping $25.00.
I did not pay the balance and I was not seen. I am horrified at this exchange and lack of professionalism shown. I myself work in a doctor office and have never treated anyone this way.  I will absolutely pay my balance but not to him and not on that day.

I will not tolerate being violated and bullied in front other patients!

originalText.text: I had a great experience, the receptionist was knowledgeable and very kind to me. The nurses were very knowledgeable which surprised me about how much the knew and how much responsibility they have and are able to execute without taking away from their courtesy and compassion. The doctor was nice and took the time to explain things I wanted to know. I had a great experience all around.

text.text: I had a great experience, the receptionist was knowledgeable and very kind to me. The nurses were very knowledgeable which surprised me about how much the knew and how much responsibility they have and are able to execute without taking away from their courtesy and compassion. The doctor was nice and took the time to explain things I wanted to know. I had a great experience all around.

originalText.text: Waited for the apt 1,5 hour to see a physician assistant instead of an actual neurologist, who requested a bunch of procedures. But when I was late for my next appt, they didn’t take me and rescheduled(after already rescheduling two of my MRIs because the MRI machine didn’t work).You need to call them and request your results after two weeks even tho your results were already ready, and they promised to upload it on their portal after 3-5 days. The office staff don’t inform you about your abnormal results and the procedures doctors requested to be done. It took me more than two months to get everything done, because it’s impossible to book an appointment and yet I haven’t seen a neurologist and got a proper treatment. I was also canceled in the evening day before the CT scan just to find out they didn’t get the authorization from my insurance? Why so late? People work and take days off to see a doctor. If you need to see a doctor immediately and get treated like me find something else and don’t waste your time. The whole system runs very poorly. 3/10. Went to the office to see a neurologist in 2023, will see them apparently in 2024 lol

originalText.text:
Terrible. The facility has very nice people working there. However, it is very badly run. There seems to be no administrative authority or patient advocate to help a consumer when you run into a difficult situation. Even some of the doctors have expressed frustration with the lack of administrative responsibility. First of all I was hit by a car upon leaving the office on June 23rd. I was injured on the hip that I went to Medical Arts to get relief for my pain management. Even though I called and left quite a few messages, I was unable to get an earlier appointment to have an injection administered to help with my pain. I tried to no avail to join the patient portal which was difficult and sometimes unavailable. I was prescribed Lyrica 100mg, 2x’s daily for pain. However, the doctor who prescribed the medication after expressing dissatisfaction with the practice
is no longer there. I sent in a request for med refill and had the receptionist send one as well. I never heard from the doctor nor was anyone covering for Dr. Singh. I attended a visit during which time I requested a refill that never came. I was in a great deal of pain. l was accused
of drug seeking. Deplorable!
